abstract: Philadelphia's newly appointed police commissioner Richard Ross, who will take post in early 2016, announces he will increase use of body cameras in department, and will limit police stops to instances of reasonable suspicion rather than using stop-and-frisk tactics.
lead_paragraph: Philadelphia’s next police commissioner said that he would expand the use of body cameras in the department and limit police stops to when there was reasonable suspicion.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: New Police Leader Calls for Curbs to Stops by Officers
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania: New Police Leader Calls for Curbs to Stops by Officers
